pronunciation: PERTA'IN, [Latin pertineo, per and tenco, to hold.]

definitions.text:
1. To belong; be the property, right or duty of.
Men hate those who affect honor by ambition, which pertaineth not them.
He took the fortified cities which pertained Judah. 2 Kings 18:13.
It pertains the governor open the ports by proclamation.
2. To have relation to. Acts 1:3.
